attributes.action: Block all EU enlargement until British taxpayers have approved it
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1975's vote on staying in the Common Market, there has never been a referendum on the set up or Britains continuing membership of the European Union.

As all politicians seem reluctant to provide the British people with a vote, the very least that should be done is to give the British taxpayer a say on whether they want to continue to fund the EU, should it keep expanding.

British taxpayers are paying for a membership which they have not agreed to.

With more Eastern European countries joining to benefit from the organisation, it is long overdue to give the British taxpayer a say on whether they want to continue contributing.

If Britain is still a democracy, it is time to prove it.
